translation: Second, if the tenth proper buddha stage in the Shared Teaching is said to be like the Buddha, then what did the old saying go, "Like the Buddha"? Some say that the bodhisattvas of the four teachings should all have the five previous characteristics of the Buddha in fruition, so they say "like the Buddha." Some say that "like the Buddha" is the same as the bodhisattvas who have reached the buddha stage and are about to run out of karmic impressions and claim to have become buddhas because they have yet to be revealed and are afraid to hinder the intention to teach.
